subject: Re: [junit] How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... I didn t mean to imply that they were exclusive, Elliotte; I was merely looking to prioritize. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Elliotte Harold wrote:
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> > OK. Does the client programmer want a nice API that doesn't work, or a
> > slightly less nice API that does?
>
> Do I want a programming language that does arithmetic or one that has
> loops? They're hardly mutually exclusive. In the long run I think the
> simpler API is more likely to work. Certainly that's been my experience.
> Complexity is harder to maintain and support.

I didn't mean to imply that they were exclusive, Elliotte; I was merely
looking to prioritize.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
